page.title: 12River Warden at Alstonfield
page.content: The job of river-warden involves wear repairs and construction, stocking the river with fish, and keeping records of fish caught and killed etc. He is not responsible for the footpaths - they are the responsibility of the County Councils, the Peak District National Park and the National Trust. There has been a river warden for about 50 years - so far there have been 7. The River Dove has been known to dry up and also flood, especially after heavy snow melts. Axe Edge Moor in Derbyshire is the source of the river and it flows 50 miles to the River Trent. The Trent flows into the sea at the Humber Estuary. There are about 135 members of the fishing club who use the river. Many of the fishermen return all their catch. Only a few are allowed to kill their catch, depending on the wieght.
